job_posting.full_description:
Are you looking for an exciting and rewarding opportunity where you can make a positive impact to the province?
Are you committed to client service and excellence and enjoy working with people? Do you enjoy challenging your skills and knowledge? If so, a career as a revenue collection officer could be for you!
We currently have an exciting and challenging opportunity for self-motivated, reliable, client and team- oriented individuals with great communication skills and a strong attention to detail to join our team.
As a member of a professional team of revenue collection officers, you will be responsible for collecting outstanding tax liabilities owed to the province. You will independently conduct investigations on businesses to ensure compliance with the filing and remittance requirements of the various statues administered. This involves contacting tax clients (via telephone and in person), negotiating to reach an agreement, and determining appropriate legal collection actions.
To succeed in this position, you will be:
Client service orientated, innovative and collaborative in your approach.
An effective communicator with strong influential and negotiation skills.
Respectful, diplomatic, confident and discreet to respond to tax client needs and difficult or confrontational situations.
Reliable, organized, self-motivated and flexible to work on multiple tasks and meet goals and objectives.
Detail oriented, analytical and an individual that thrives on applying initiative.
Committed to the core values of the Government of Saskatchewan.
The knowledge and abilities required would typically be obtained through:
The completion of post-secondary education resulting in a degree or diploma focused on accounting. An equivalent combination of education and/or experience will also be considered.
Experience using a variety of computer software applications such as Microsoft Office products.
Prospective candidates with required education outside of Canada are strongly encouraged to obtain either an ICAS Assessment Report from
www.icascanada.ca
or a Credential Evaluation and Authentication Report from
www.wes.org
, including it with your application. Please also include a copy of your transcripts with your application. This will aid in ensuring that your qualifications are appropriately evaluated and considered in the application process.
Candidates must clearly indicate in their cover letter how they have acquired the skills and abilities required for this position. Candidates will be screened based on the information provided.
What We Offer:
Work life balance.
An inclusive work environment.
A competitive salary.
Comprehensive benefits package, including pension.
Vacation, earned days off (EDO) and other types of leave (maternity/paternity/adoption, family/personal leave, sick leave).
Career advancement opportunities which include the ability to progress to a level 9 collection officer position based on your ability to successfully demonstrate the competencies of a level 9 collection officer.
